questions.question: We will cancel the trip ……………………….. it rains.
questions.description: We use if to express a condition.

questions.question: We will not cancel the trip …………………………. it rains.
questions.description: Even if refers to future. Even if means no matter what.

questions.question: He was acquitted …………………………… he was guilty.
questions.description: Though is used to connect two contrasting ideas.

questions.question: He was freed ………………………….. he was innocent.
questions.description: Because expresses the reason for something.

questions.question: There is no doubt ………………………… the earth moves around the sun.
questions.description: That is used to introduce a noun clause.

questions.question: You will not get the job …………………………. you deserve it.
He lost his balance …………………………… fell off the ladder.
He is richer ………………………. I am.
questions.description: Richer is a comparative expression use than after it.

questions.question: You will never succeed …………………………. you try.
…………………………. I were you, I wouldn’t tolerate this.

questions.question: I trust him ………………………… he is honest.
